name: Arugula
climate: Arugula thrives in cool climates, where temperatures range between 45-65Â°F.
In warmer climates, arugula may bolt quickly, altering its taste significantly.
Growing arugula in spring or fall can help avoid the stress of extreme heat.
Consistent and gradual temperature changes are best for arugula cultivation.
sunlight: Arugula prefers full sun, with at least 6 hours of sunlight each day.
It can also grow in partial shade, especially in very hot climates.
Morning sunlight combined with afternoon shade can benefit arugula growth.
Excessive shade can lead to slower growth and a less peppery taste.
watering: Arugula needs consistently moist soil but should never be waterlogged.
Regular watering is essential, especially in hot and dry periods.
Over-watering can harm arugula by causing root rot and other issues.
A deep watering routine once or twice a week is often recommended.
soil: Arugula flourishes in well-draining, fertile soil rich in organic matter.
A pH level between 6.0 and 7.0 is ideal for growing healthy arugula.
Soil should be loose, allowing roots to expand and access nutrients easily.
Heavy clay soils should be avoided, as they can retain excess moisture.
extra_care_tip: Regularly harvesting the leaves encourages new growth and prevents bolting.
